shots.description: Medium close-up on Nick's contemplative face, low-key lighting casting shadows that accentuate his furrowed brow. The camera lingers, capturing the weight of his inner turmoil.
shots.dialogue: "...the fundamental decencies is parcelled out unequally at birth."

shots.description: Close-up on Nick's eyes, a flicker of doubt and uncertainty reflected in them. The camera slowly pulls back, revealing him alone in a dimly lit room, surrounded by shadows.
shots.dialogue: "And, after boasting this way of my tolerance, I come to the admission that it has a limit."

shots.description: Over-the-shoulder shot, framing Nick's silhouette against a window overlooking the vibrant city lights. The contrast between his stillness and the bustling world outside is stark.
shots.dialogue: "Conduct may be founded on the hard rock or the wet marshes, but after a certain point I don't care what it's founded on."

shots.description: Close-up on Nick's face, a subtle shift in his expression as he recalls a memory. The camera slowly pans to reveal a glimpse of the autumn landscape through the window, leaves falling gently.
shots.dialogue: "When I came back from the East last autumn I felt that I wanted the world to be in uniform and at a sort of moral attention forever..."

shots.description: Medium shot, framing Nick in the center of the frame, his body language conveying a sense of weariness and disillusionment. The lighting is low and moody, casting long shadows across the room.
shots.dialogue: "...I wanted no more riotous excursions with privileged glimpses into the human heart."

shots.description: Close-up on Nick's face, his expression softening as he remembers Gatsby. The camera slowly pulls back, revealing a framed photograph of Gatsby on a nearby table, bathed in a warm, nostalgic glow.
shots.dialogue: "Only Gatsby, the man who gives his..."
